channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Nvidia $279 billion wipeout — the biggest in U.S. history — drags down global chip stocks
item.description: In the U.S., chipmaker Nvidia plunged more than 9% in regular trading, leading semiconductor stocks lower amid a sell-off on Wall Street.

item.title: Volkswagen faces tense townhall as workers battle possible plant closures
item.description: Management at German automotive giant Volkswagen is set to go toe-to-toe with workers on Wednesday as leaders are set to present details about possible cuts.

item.title: European markets lower; tech stocks down 2.4% following declines on Wall Street
item.description: European stocks fell sharply at the open Wednesday, following steep losses on Wall Street Tuesday and in Asia-Pacific markets overnight.

item.title: Cathay Pacific confirms it expects A350s back in service within days after engine issue
item.description: The Hong Kong airline said 15 of the 48 Airbus A350s in its fleet were found to have engine fuel lines that required replacement.

item.title: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba tenders resignation, parliament speaker says
item.description: Dmytro Kuleba has represented Ukraine's foreign interests throughout Kyiv's battle against the invasion of neighboring Russia.

item.title: Nvidia down 2% in premarket trading after plunge that wiped out nearly $300 billion in market cap
item.description: Nvidia's huge rise in recent years has been directly related to its dominance in AI chips for data centers.

item.title: Social media platform Bluesky attracts millions in Brazil after judge bans Musk's X
item.description: Following Brazil's recent ban of Elon Musk's X platform, its users in the country appear to switching over to rival platforms.

item.title: Robinhood lets Brits lend shares for extra income in bid to grow international footprint
item.description: Robinhood on Wednesday launched a new feature in the U.K. allowing users to lend out any stocks they own outright in their portfolio to interested borrowers.

item.title: I reached financial freedom at the age of 38 – here are 4 money principles I live by
item.description: Today, Shao Chun, 38, lives off of his seven figure investment portfolio. Here are four money rules he lives by.

item.title: First France, now South Korea — Telegram's legal troubles are only growing. Here's why
item.description: Telegram is facing a probe in South Korea, where police suspect it of helping spread illicit deepfake porn, adding to the platform's mounting legal troubles.

item.title: 'Many doors were slammed in our face’: Spice Girl Mel B speaks of music industry sexism in the 1990s
item.description: Spice Girl Mel B says the iconic girl band wanted to "empower women" after facing sexism in the male-dominated music industry of the 90s.

item.title: Oil prices extend slump on likely restoration of Libyan production, OPEC+ plans to raise output
item.description: Oil prices extended their previous session's losses on the back of Libya's oil production coming back online and a persistent weak demand in China.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Nvidia sinks and data’s weak, but hold on
item.description: In the wake of Tuesday's sell-off, some investing advice from the recently reunited band Oasis: “Hold on/ Don’t be scared.”

item.title: Nvidia plunges almost 10%, dragging basket of chip stocks to worst day since March 2020
item.description: Nvidia's steep drop Tuesday knocked almost $300 billion in market cap off the chipmaker and weighed on the broader market.

item.title: India's Modi expected to usher in new era of bilateral agreements in Singapore visit
item.description: The Indian prime minister had also visited Italy, Russia, Ukraine, Poland and Brunei in the last three months since his reelection.

item.title: The latest hiccup in Trump’s crypto launch: Deleted posts and a hacking claim
item.description: Donald Trump's new crypto project appears to fall prey to hack Tuesday.

item.title: Mongolia was meant to arrest Russia's President Putin last night. It didn't, and now it's in trouble
item.description: Mongolia, as a member of the International Criminal Court, should have arrested the Russian president as soon as he landed on Mongolian soil Monday evening.

item.title: Weak manufacturing measures raise specter of U.S. economic slowdown
item.description: The ISM monthly survey of purchasing managers showed that just 47.2% reported expansion in August.

item.title: Elon Musk's Starlink says it will block X in Brazil to keep satellite internet active
item.description: SpaceX satellite internet service Starlink said it will comply with court orders to block social network X in Brazil.

item.title: Chinese consumer brands look to crack the global market with Singapore as a testbed
item.description: Chinese consumer brands are using Singapore as a cultural testbed in their push to build an international business.

item.title: 'Golden era' for Hong Kong retail is over as Chinese tourists continue to tighten their purse strings
item.description: Real estate analysts claimed that the shopping frenzy the city once experienced will not return "for a long, long time."

item.title: Russia signals its official stance on using nuclear weapons is about to change, accusing the West of 'escalation'
item.description: Russia has again hinted that it is making changes to its official policy on the use of nuclear weapons, as Ukraine's incursion into the Kursk region continues.

item.title: Volkswagen braces for showdown with unions after warning of possible German plant closures
item.description: Volkswagen's management is expected to lay out their cost-cutting plans to about 18,000 workers at a town hall meeting in Wolfsburg on Wednesday.

item.title: Starlink in Brazil's crosshairs as spat over Elon Musk's X escalates
item.description: The confrontation between Brazil and Musk continues to escalate over the country's decision to block his social media company X.

item.title: Former top aide to New York Gov. Hochul charged with acting as foreign agent for China
item.description: Linda Sun, who had been New York Gov. Kathy Hochul's deputy chief of staff, is accused of laundering millions of dollars received from China.

item.title: Tesla Cybertruck is in a category of its own for better or worse
item.description: The Cybertruck, which in many ways is more "cyber" than "truck," has created a new segment in the automotive industry that it solely holds.

item.title: Trump Media stock slides under $18, a new low since it began publicly trading
item.description: The DJT stock is often traded as a proxy of political support for Donald Trump in the presidential race against Vice President Kamala Harris.

item.title: Klarna rival Zilch posts first profit and appoints ex-Aviva CEO to board ahead of IPO
item.description: Philip Belamant, Zilch's CEO, told CNBC the firm was able to hit profitability by growing rather than cutting back like other fintechs have done.

item.title: Rolls-Royce shares rise after Cathay Pacific says A350 engine issue affects limited flights
item.description: Cathay Pacific has identified an engine component failure in 15 of its A350 aircraft, a long-range, wide-body which uses Rolls-Royce engines.

item.title: China's first global gaming hit sells millions in a week. An early investor shares what's next
item.description: China's first attempt at a top-tier video game has smashed world records, bolstering the industry's global ambitions after Beijing's gaming crackdown.
